section.title: Past Perfect Simple
section.sectiontitle: Use the Past Perfect Simple to talk about an action that happened before another action in the past. Form the Past Perfect Simple with had + past participle.
section.text1a: When I saw him I realised I'd met him before.
section.text2a: By the time we got to the restaurant, I hadn't eaten all day.
section.sectiontitle2: The Past Perfect Simple is common after verbs of saying/thinking. The Past Perfect Simple is also common after when.
section.text3a: She realised she'd met him before somewhere.
section.text4a: When he'd finished the washing up, he turned the TV on.
